div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of CHIN SHEUNG WING, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
No. 3072 REPLY TO RETURN OF WRIT.

In answer to the Return of Writ herein, the applicant says: that he was denied a proper hearing; that the Immigration officials abused their discretion and acted in an unlawful and improper way and that their finding that this applicant was not a son of Chin Kim was a mere subterfuge; that they are convinced that this applicant is the son Chin Kim, a citizen of the United States and that he would have been landed had they have given proper consideration to the order of discharge made by Honorable C. H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled Court; that they did not give proper consideration or any consideration to said finding but instead, they totally disregarded the same, all of which is contrary to the laws and treaties of the United States.
State of Washington County of King} ss.

Daniel Landon being first duly sworn on oath says: That he is the atty for Petitioner in the above entitled action; that he has read the foregoing Reply to return of writ knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true:
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 31 day of Aug 1915
Albert Woodie Notary Public for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
IN THE District Court Of the United States For the Northern District of Washington Western Division
In the Matter of the Application of CHIN SHEUNG WING, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
SERVICE OF PAPERS IN THIS CASE MAY BE MADE ON DANIEL LANDON Attorney for Proctor for{ Petitioner. 1054-5-6 EMIPIRE BLDG., SEATTLE, KING COUNTY, WASHINGTON PHONE MAIN 4802
FILED iN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION AUG 30 1915 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Emy Deputy 2x
